triples.name: Unmanned surface vehicle
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of multiple unmanned surface vehicles in formation control scenarios.

triples.name: Consensus (computer science)
triples.relevance: The paper transforms formation control into consensus achievement of auxiliary variables among the vehicles.

triples.name: Radial basis function network
triples.relevance: RBFNNs are utilized in the paper to handle dynamic uncertainties in the control system.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: An adaptive strategy is employed to counteract external disturbances and model parametric uncertainties.

triples.name: Event-driven architecture
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an event-triggered mechanism that triggers control updates based on system events rather than fixed time intervals.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The paper is fundamentally grounded in control theory for designing formation control strategies for multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses leaderless formation control for multiple unmanned surface vehicles operating as a coordinated multi-agent system.

triples.name: Deadband
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel dynamic deadband intermittent event-triggered mechanism that improves upon existing event-triggered control approaches.
